page.title: 09POLITICS IN HOLTON-LE-CLAY
page.content: A newly elected County Councillor gave us the{voting figures of the 1985 {County Council Election.}They were :- {Conservative candidate 878 votes {Independant candidate 728 votes {Liberal candidate 553 votes {Labour candidate 293 votes During the elections people asked about the following things:{dustbins, {a better bus service, education and {lower rates.}The council help our village by providing better roadways, police and education. Our councillor has always voted Conservative. She was a{Parish Councillor}for 10 years, a {District Councillor}for 3 years and has been a{County Councillor}for 3 months. Many people are grateful for what the council do. If it affects people personally they are satisfied, but generally they do not notice.
